Deleting Workspaces

You can delete a workspace when it is no longer of use to the current project database. You can delete both public and private workspaces, however, you cannot delete the Root Workspace. When you delete a workspace, all of the workspaces that were derived from it are also deleted. You cannot delete an active workspace or the parent of an active workspace. Note that any changes you make to a public workspace affect everyone using it.

To delete a workspace:

  1. Select File | Set Workspaces. The Set Workspaces dialog box appears with a list of all workspaces defined for the project database.

  2. Select the name of the workspace you want to delete from the list of workspaces.

  3. Click Delete. The Confirm Workspace Delete dialog box asks if you are sure you want to delete the workspace.

  4. Click Yes to delete the workspace or No to cancel.

  5. Click OK to return to the Version Manager main window.
